description: Japanese thimbleweed (Anemone hupehensis) is an amazing plant species with many outstanding features. It is an eye-catching perennial that produces clusters of pink, white, or deep purple flowers in early spring, giving a much-welcomed splash of color to the landscape. It does well in partial shade and moist, well-drained soils. Surprisingly, this perennial is semi-evergreen, meaning it will provide interest in winter in mild climates. Additionally, Japanese thimbleweed is beautiful, deer-resistant and fast-growing, adding a stunning display to any garden.
